parameters.content:
# üë• Workflow 2: Client Filtering & Slack Onboarding Workflow

## This workflow ensures that **only new clients** are identified and onboarded properly by following these steps:

# 1. Fetch Airtable Records
- ## Retrieve all records where `Added_to_Channel = FALSE`.

## 2. Loop Over Each Client
- ## Process each client record individually for precise control.
- ## Extract key information:
  - ## Client name
  - ## Email address
  - ## Record ID
  - ## Slack channel ID
  - ## Slack channel Email

# 3. Get Slack User ID
- ## Use **Slack `users.lookupByEmail` API** with the client‚Äôs email.
- ## Filter the API response to get a valid Slack ID.
# 4. Loop and IF Logic Management
- ## Send the output from both the set node where the slack id and is_in_workspace extracted and 'Extract record id, Slack channel id and link, email, client name1' set node
  ## to the merge node.
- ## Then we flatten all the combination down into one array using the code node and then we use the if which checks if that client exist in the worksapce or not.
- ## If yes, then it will invite the user via slack api call converstaion.invite to ther private channel, post the welcome message 
  ## into the slack private channel for that client, update airtable variable add to their channel and send the message with the private channel link for them.
- ## IF no, then  it wills end a remnider email to the client saying join the workapce so that we can add you to the private channel.

=Hey there, welcome aboard! 
üéâ We‚Äôre super happy to have you on the team. 

üöÄ This would be your Official Communication Medium with the owner of the project and I'll be keep updating you about the weekly progress of your project, share what you‚Äôre working on, and don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out if you need anything.

Let‚Äôs build something awesome together, in shaa‚Äô Allah

parameters.subject: Access Your Private Project Channel on Slack
parameters.message:
=Hi {{ $json["Client Full Name?"] }},

Here‚Äôs the link to access your private Slack channel:
üîó Private Channel: {{ $json["Slack Channel Link"] }}

This channel is your dedicated space for all project-related communication. Here's what you can expect:

Weekly project updates will be shared here to keep you informed of progress.

You can ask your Project Manager any questions directly in this channel.

Once the project is complete, you‚Äôll also receive a final confirmation and wrap-up message here.

If you have any trouble accessing the channel, please don‚Äôt hesitate to reach out.


Best regards,
Project Manager

parameters.content:
## ‚è∞ Schedule Trigger

- ### You can use it according to your own interest. Since this works for all clients project in the Database so you can run this everyday.
- ### The "Search Records" node returns all record from the *All Project List*

## üìÖ Workflow 3: Weekly Project Updates via Slack  

- We loop through each record in the **All Project List** table.  
- Only records where the **Update Ready** field = `Yes` are selected.  

### üõ†Ô∏è How the Update Ready Field Works  
- A **formula field** in Airtable checks if **7 days** have passed since the last update.  
- If **‚â• 7 days** ‚Üí `Update Ready = Yes`.  
- If **< 7 days** ‚Üí `Update Ready = No`.  
- The **IF node** in n8n filters records accordingly.  

### üöÄ Update Process  
1. For eligible projects, update the **Last Weekly Update Sent** field with today‚Äôs date.  
2. Pass project details (Name, Scope, Tasks, Progress) to **Gemini LLM**.  
3. Gemini generates a structured **weekly update** including:  
   - ‚úÖ Tasks completed  
   - üïë Tasks in progress  
   - ‚è≥ Pending tasks  
   - üìä Overall project percentage  
4. Send the generated update message directly into the client‚Äôs **Slack channel**.

parameters.subject: Project Completed! üéâ Invoice & Next Steps Inside

=Hi {{ $json.query.client_name }},

We‚Äôre pleased to inform you that your project has been successfully completed. üéâ

Please find the invoice details below:

Preview Online: [{{ $json.document.public_share_link }}]

Download PDF: [{{ $json.document.download_url }}]

Kindly review the invoice and proceed with payment at your earliest convenience. Once the payment is received, we will promptly deliver the final project files.

Thank you for choosing our service. We appreciate your business and look forward to working with you again in the future.

Best regards,
Project Manager

Thank you once again for your trust in Tech Savory. We‚Äôre glad to have successfully completed and delivered your project.

To help us continue improving our services, we‚Äôd be grateful if you could take a moment to fill out this short feedback form:

üîó Feedback Form: https://form.typeform.com/to/tOvfcp61

Your honest feedback helps us grow and serve you better in the future.

We truly appreciate your time!

Warm regards,
Project Manager

parameters.content:
# üí≥ Workflow 4: Automated Invoice Generation via Airtable + PDFMonkey  

## üõ†Ô∏è How the Invoice Trigger Works  

## üöÄ Invoice Process  
1. **Webhook Node**  
   - Airtable checks the **Project Percentage** field.  
   - If `= 100%` ‚Üí **Generate Invoice button** is available.  
   - When pressed, Airtable sends the project data to n8n via a **Webhook**.  
   - Captures important project fields (Client name, Email, Project ID, Price, etc.).  

2. **PDFMonkey - Create Invoice**  
   - Use an **HTTP POST** request to PDFMonkey.  
   - Send captured data from Airtable.  
   - Include a variable `status: pending` to indicate invoice creation.  

3. **PDFMonkey - Retrieve Invoice PDF**  
   - Use an **HTTP GET** request with the document ID from the POST step.  
   - Retrieve invoice file links:  
     - üì• Downloadable PDF URL  
     - üåê Public share link  

4. **Merge + Flatten**  
   - Merge the invoice URLs with Airtable record data.  
   - Flatten into a single array for clean mapping.  

5. **Email Client**  
   - Use **Gmail Node** to send the invoice PDF as an attachment.  
   - Subject: ‚ÄúYour Project Invoice from [Company]‚Äù  
   - Body: includes public invoice link + payment instructions.  

6. **Slack Notification**  
   - From the same flattened data, send a Slack message to the client‚Äôs private channel:  
     - ‚Äú‚úÖ Your project is now **100% complete**. An invoice has been generated and sent to your email.‚Äù

# üì© Workflow 5: Send Feedback Form after Invoice Paid  

## üöÄ Process  
1. **Webhook Node**  
   - In Airtable, once the **Invoice Status = Paid**, the **Send Feedback** button becomes active.  
   - When pressed, Airtable triggers a **Webhook** in n8n. 
   - Webhook Captures client details from Airtable (Name, Email, Project ID).  

2. **Send Feedback Email (Gmail Node)**  
   - Subject: ‚ÄúWe‚Äôd love your feedback on [Project Name]‚Äù  
   - Body: Includes a link to the **Typeform feedback survey**.  
   - Sent directly to the client‚Äôs email.  

# üìù Workflow 6: Process Feedback Submission via Typeform  


## üöÄ Process  
1. **Typeform Trigger Node**  
    - A client submits the **Typeform feedback survey**.  
    - The **Typeform Trigger Node** activates in n8n.  
    - Captures feedback responses along with the client‚Äôs email.  

2. **Airtable Lookup**  
   - Find the corresponding record in Airtable using the client‚Äôs email.  

3. **Update Airtable Record**  
   - Save the feedback answers into the record.  
   - Update project status:  
     - `Project Status = Closed`  
     - `Feedback = [Responses from Typeform]`

values.content:
=Role:
You are an AI project assistant that creates a list of default project tasks.

Expectation:
Each time a new project is created, you should return a clear, structured set of tasks.

Action:
Generate a task list based on the project type, with fields:

i) Task Name.

ii) Assigned To (based on role: e.g. PM, Designer, Ops)

iii) Status = ‚ÄúNot started‚Äù (default)

iv) Due Date = relative to project start date

v) Client-Project: {{ $json.fields['Client - Project'] }}

Context:

This is part of an onboarding automation system where tasks must be tracked in Airtable. Each task will be linked to a project.

Target:

Provide a short, actionable list of tasks (3‚Äì6 items) depending on the project type.

Example (for mock data):

Website Project

i) Kickoff Call ‚Üí Assigned to PM ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +2 days from start

ii) Create Drive Folder ‚Üí Assigned to Ops ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +1 day from start

iii) First Draft Design ‚Üí Assigned to Designer ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +5 days from start

Marketing Project

i) Kickoff Call ‚Üí Assigned to PM ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +2 days

ii) Campaign Strategy Draft ‚Üí Assigned to Marketing Lead ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +5 days

iii) Asset Creation ‚Üí Assigned to Designer ‚Üí Status: Not started ‚Üí Due: +7 days


Example of Output Format(Make the output same as it is): 
Note: I want output exactly in this format.
[
  {
    "Client-Project" : "{{ $json.fields['Client - Project'] }}",
    "Task Name": "Kickoff Call",
    "Assigned To": "PM",
    "Status": "Not started",
    "Due Date": "MM/DD/YYYY"
  },
  {
    "Client-Project" : "{{ $json.fields['Client - Project'] }}",
    "Task Name": "Create Drive Folder",
    "Assigned To": "Ops",
    "Status": "Not started",
    "Due Date": "MM/DD/YYYY"
  },
  {
    "Client-Project" : "{{ $json.fields['Client - Project'] }}",
    "Task Name": "First Draft Design",
    "Assigned To": "Designer",
    "Status": "Not started",
    "Due Date": "MM/DD/YYYY"
  }
]

parameters.channelId:
={{ ($json["Full Name?"] + "-" + $json["Project Name?"])
.toLowerCase()
.replace(/[^a-z0-9-]/g, '') // keep only allowed chars
.replace(/[-]+/g, '-') // collapse repeats
.replace(/^-+|-+$/g, '') // trim leading/trailing dashes
.slice(0,80) // enforce 80 char limit
}}

parameters.subject: =Onboarding üöÄ: Slack Workspace and Drive Links for You
parameters.message:
=Hi {{ $json['Full Name?'] }},

Welcome! To get things started, please use the links below to ensure everything is working correctly:

Workspace Invite: {{ $json['Workspace Link:'] }}
This link will allow you to join our Slack workspace. Once you're in, we‚Äôll add you to your dedicated private channel for streamlined communication with our team.

Drive Link: {{ $json['Drive Link'] }}
This is your shared Drive folder. You can use it to upload or access any relevant documents we may need throughout the project.


Thans for your time.

parameters.content:
## **üìä Response ‚Üí Airtable**

1. **Form Data Storage**  
   - Incoming client responses are written into **Airtable** (`All Project List` table).  
   - Captured fields: `Name`, `Email`, `Project Type`, `Notes`.  

2. **Task Generation (LLM)**  
   - Client project details are passed to an **LLM** prompt to auto-generate a structured **task list**.  
   - Prompt must be customized to your project needs (define variables clearly).  

3. **Output Formatting**  
   - Since LLM responses can be inconsistent (e.g., dumping multiple fields into one string), a **Code node** restructures the output.  
   - Reformatted tasks are pushed into **Airtable** (`Tasks` table) with clean variables.  
4. **Extract Airtbale ID for further use**
   - We also extracted the ID using the set node and passed it to the merge node for further use.

  - 
> **Maintenance Note:**  
> If Airtable schema or LLM prompt structure changes, update both the mapping node and the post-processing code.
## üìä Loop over the task created via LLM for the Project ‚Üí Store them into Airtable (New table name " Task Table ", not the old one " All Project List ")

# üìÇ Slack & Drive Setup ‚Üí Client Record Update  

## 1. Extract Variables  
- Select only the required client details (name, email, project name, Objective, Company name, Status) for folder/channel creation.  

## 2. Google Drive Setup  
- Create a **new folder** for the client.  
- Enable Sharing of Folder with that Client.  

## 3. Slack Setup  
- Create a **private Slack channel** for the client via Bot.  
- Add the required owner(s) to the channel.  
- Extract the **Channel ID** and **Workspace ID** for later use.  

## 4. Merge Outputs  
- Combine Drive folder link + Slack channel info into one dataset.  
- Flatten into a clean array for easier handling.  

## 5. Update Airtable Client Record  
- Store the Drive link and Slack channel link in the client‚Äôs Airtable record.  

## 6. Share Resources with Client  
- Share the Google Drive folder directly with the client.  
- Send an **onboarding email** containing:  
  - Drive folder link  
  - Slack Workspace link (Because client had to be in your workspace for adding in to their private channel)  

---

### ‚öôÔ∏è Maintenance Note  
- No LLM is used in this step since the **welcome email** is a standardized template (Because I think it's redundant to use LLM here).  
- Keeps the process **lightweight** and **scalable** for every new client.  
- If personalization is later required (e.g., tailoring based on project type), consider adding LLM here ‚Äî but keep it optional.

#  üìä Workflow 1: Client Onboarding Automation Workflow  

## This workflow automates the **entire client onboarding process**, including:  
- ## Adding the client to **Slack**. 
- ## Creating and storing records in **Airtable**.
- ## Generating structured **project tasks**.  
- ## Creating a dedicated **Google Drive folder**.  
- ## Sharing all relevant resources with the client.
